intro: Geraniospermum inquinans, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae, which includes plants with showy, often pink or red flowers. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, hairy stems, and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence. Geraniospermum inquinans is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
